title: Product Developer - Parental Cover
description:
**Established in 1986 in the Swedish mountains, our love for skiing in untouched terrain and embarking on adventures in the wild run deep. Our purpose is simple: to bring this freeride spirit to the world. With our products, we aim to make adventures possible 365 days a year.**

**We are driven by passion, togetherhood, responsibility and winning spirit. We know that an inspiring spread of unique abilities and personalities** **contribute to our dynamic culture and our success. Now, we are looking for a new talent to join our team.**


This is an opportunity for you who want to work in a cross-functional team with developing our high-quality products to our end consumer all over the world.


You will have an important role in the exciting and yet complex process of creating our fantastic products. Together with a tight team you will work with the development and innovation of our different product lines, ensuring that each piece meets the brand’s high standards for quality, design and sustainability.


You will be working in a dynamic and global organization, where teamwork and passion are key factors for our success. The position is based at Peak Performance HQ in Stockholm where you will be part of our Product Development team and report to Product Development Manager. The employment is a temporary position that aims to replace an employee on parental leave for approximately one year.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Cross-functional Collaboration:** Work closely with Product Managers, Designers, Pattern Makers, Fabric and Quality teams, as well as the Merch team in Hong Kong, throughout the entire product development process.
* **Product Development & Optimization:** Suggest alternative fabrics, trims, and construction methods to ensure products meet quality, sustainability, and cost targets. Actively participate in fittings and development meetings.
* **Technical Documentation & Sample Management:** Prepare and maintain accurate product instructions for suppliers and PCOs. Manage fabric orders and sample coordination as needed.
* **Quality & Sustainability Assurance:** Ensure all products meet Peak Performance’s premium quality standards and align with our sustainability goals, in accordance with the Quality Assurance Manual (QAM).
* **Market & Consumer Insight:** Develop with a digital-first and end-user-first mindset, staying informed about market trends, competitors, and consumer needs.
* **Supplier Communication & Negotiation:** Negotiate pricing, minimum order quantities, and other production terms with suppliers and the Hong Kong production team.
* **Knowledge Sharing & Team Contribution:** Share expertise and insights within the product development team and across functions to support a collaborative and innovative work environment.

**Job Requirements:**

* Minimum 5 year of industry relevant experience in product development work
* A master degree from relevant study, e.g., textile management or business administration
* English high level required (daily correspondence)
* A strong team player with excellent communication skills.
* A prestige less doer a with a flexible attitude.
* The ability to plan, organize and prioritize managing multiple tasks and projects at the same time, often with tight deadlines.
* Result oriented and commercial thinking.

**What we offer:**


We offer you an inspiring work environment where our values of Passion, Togetherhood, Responsibility and Winning Spirit are at the core of everything we do, promoting creativity, teamwork, accountability, and progress. You get the opportunity to work with a great team that shares your passion for sports and outdoor life. We are on a growth journey, finding our line and building our future success. That provides interesting challenges and possibilities in all roles for the person who is curious and likes to get things done. We’re small enough for you to play a key role regardless of your position, but big enough to have a global presence. At Peak Performance, you get the best of both worlds.


To live our brand, we also offer:

* Workout classes and yoga classes in our Training Box at HQ
* Sports Hour – 1 hour training on Fridays (activity of your own choice)
* Mountain house & Apartment in Åre. Available for rent and team activities.
* Health care allowance – 3000 SEK per year
* Skandia Health Insurance


If our values inspire you and you share our passion for outdoor sports and products that combines style and performance, we want you to join our winning team. Apply now and unlock your freeride spirit!

title: .NET Developer
description:
**Role:**  

As a .NET developer, you will be part of a team responsible for maintaining and supporting business-critical applications, many of which are essential to our day-to-day operations. At the same time, you will contribute to the gradual modernization of our technology stack.  

  

You will work primarily with backend development in .NET, ensuring the stability and performance of existing systems. While your main focus will be on maintenance and improvement of current solutions, you will also have the opportunity to participate in developing new technical capabilities. Experience in frontend development is a plus, as we collaborate closely with teams working on our digital interfaces.

**Essential requirements:**  

* Experience with .NET / .NET Core (multiple versions) (4+ years)
* Proficiency in C# (4+ years)
* Experience with REST APIs / Web services (4+ years)
* Fluency in Swedish and English with strong communication skills (4+ years)

  

**Meritorious:**  

* Experience with containerization or microservices (e.g., Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Kafka)
* Front-end development experience (including Blazor)
* Experience with Azure DevOps
* Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
 **Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Stockholm  

**Period**: 02-06-2025-31-12-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 14-05-2025  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Android Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Proven experience in Android application development
* Master’s degree in Software Engineering or equivalent relevant experience
* Minimum 6 years of experience in software development using Java/Kotlin
* Experience working in a Linux environment
* Proficiency in writing automated unit and integration tests in Java/Kotlin
* Familiarity with tools such as Git, Gerrit, and Jenkins
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken

  

**Meritorious**  

* Experience in the automotive and infotainment domains
* Experience working in international environments
* Familiarity with tools such as Jira, Car Weaver, and Teamcenter
* Valid driver’s license (Category B)

  

**Application deadline:** 15-05-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  

  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

title: Senior integrationsutvecklare till storbank
description:
**Om tjänsten**  

Vi söker nu en senior integrationsutvecklare som vill vara med och forma framtidens systemlandskap inom Ekonomi och Finans hos en av Sveriges storbanker. Du blir en nyckelspelare i ett team som arbetar enligt ett Lean-agilt ramverk med starkt fokus på modern utvecklingspraxis, molnbaserade lösningar och kontinuerlig förbättring. Med din tekniska expertis kommer du att bidra i både utvecklings- och mentorroller i ett sammansvetsat team med hög ambition och starkt samarbete.


**Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter**  

Du kommer att spela en central roll i teamets utvecklingsarbete, både genom att driva tekniska lösningar och stötta kollegor. Tillsammans med ditt team planerar ni i tvåveckorssprintar, med tydligt fokus på kvalitet, prestanda och säkerhet.


Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:

* Utveckla och underhålla systemintegrationer, främst i Java och ODI/ATP.
* Arbeta med DevOps-verktyg som Jenkins och GitLab CI.
* Ansvara för databashantering i Oracle och SQL Server.
* Delta i sprintplanering och leverans enligt LF-modellen.
* Fungera som teknisk vägledare och mentor i teamet.
* Säkerställa robusta och säkra integrationslösningar.
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner och andra nyckelroller inom organisationen.

**Vi söker dig som**  

Har flerårig erfarenhet som integrationsutvecklare med djup teknisk kompetens inom Java och ODI/ATP, samt goda kunskaper i databashantering och DevOps-metodik.

**Krav:**

* Flera års erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling.
* Djup kompetens i Java och ODI/ATP.
* Vana av DevOps och CI/CD (Jenkins, GitLab CI).
* Gedigen erfarenhet av databashantering och SQL-optimering (Oracle och SQL Server).
* Förståelse för databasdesign, performance tuning och avancerade databaskomponenter (stored procedures, triggers).

**Meriterande:**

* Erfarenhet av Oracle Integration Cloud (PaaS/SaaS).
* Tidigare arbete inom bank, finans eller ekonomi.
* Erfarenhet från liknande transformationsprojekt.


Du är självgående, handlingskraftig och har en stark förmåga att samarbeta. Du ser vad som behöver göras, tar initiativ och har lätt för att dela med dig av din kunskap för att stötta teamet. Din problemlösningsförmåga kombinerat med god kommunikation gör dig till en naturlig mentor.

**Övrig information**

* **Start:** Enligt överenskommelse
* **Plats:** Stockholm, med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
* **Omfattning:** Heltid, med flexibilitet i arbetsplats och arbetstider.
* **Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare

**Om Wrknest**  

På Wrknest gör vi inte som alla andra. Vi tror på att hela tiden våga se nya möjligheter och tänka nytt. När vi startade var det för att utmana gamla sätt att rekrytera på. Vi lever i en tid av snabb digital utveckling. Kunskap behöver förnyas kontinuerligt för att vara aktuell. Därför gäller det att kunna ställa om snabbt. Det här gör att vi inte enbart tittar på kandidatens CV vid en rekrytering. Istället ser vi till den samlade potentialen och erbjuder individanpassad upskilling. På så vis kan vi snabbt matcha de kunskapsbehov som finns just nu. Läs mer på www.wrknest.se.

title: .NET Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Role:**  

As a .NET developer, you will be part of a team responsible for maintaining and supporting business-critical applications, many of which are essential to our day-to-day operations. At the same time, you will contribute to the gradual modernization of our technology stack.  

  

You will work primarily with backend development in .NET, ensuring the stability and performance of existing systems. While your main focus will be on maintenance and improvement of current solutions, you will also have the opportunity to participate in developing new technical capabilities. Experience in frontend development is a plus, as we collaborate closely with teams working on our digital interfaces.

**Essential requirements:**  

* Experience with .NET / .NET Core (multiple versions) (4+ years)
* Proficiency in C# (4+ years)
* Experience with REST APIs / Web services (4+ years)
* Fluency in Swedish and English with strong communication skills (4+ years)

  

**Meritorious:**  

* Experience with containerization or microservices (e.g., Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Kafka)
* Front-end development experience (including Blazor)
* Experience with Azure DevOps
* Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP

  

**Last day to apply**: 14-05-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  

  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

title: Software Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We are looking for an experienced Developer who wants to be at the forefront of large-scale software development, within our near real-time Business Support Solutions with focus on Charging and 5G.

  

"A world where limitless connectivity improves lives, redefines business and pioneers a sustainable future." Our systems are developed with industry-standard technologies, geared for virtualization and  

cloud environment, with excellent user experience in mind.

  

We have a lot of fun & offer great career opportunities, so apply now so we can wish you Welcome to join us and our strong teams! As a bonus, you get the opportunity to live in the appealing world heritage town of Karlskrona, just near a beautiful archipelago with over 600 islands to visit.

 **What you will do:**


Work in Ericsson Karlskrona means working in an inspiring, fun, learning and creative environment. Our guiding lights are respect, perseverance, professionalism and integrity.

  

Your role will include various development activities such as requirement analysis, software design, integration, verification, tool design and product troubleshooting.  

The exact work is to be agreed upon between you and us. Once settled into the development role we can offer several technical career paths. We work in a global world in close collaboration and cooperation with our colleagues in India.

  

The development team adopts Agile ways of working, in which continuous improvement and Innovation are practiced in daily work. Our team consists of experienced software developers sharing your interest in programming.

* We mainly focus on back-end development but some teams works in front-end as well.
* We work with customer-driven development of a product with high-performance standards.
* Our working methodology is based on Automation and CICD as our cornerstones in our code production.
* We offer the possibility to have a high growth in your software developer role (including technical leadership) and being challenged in different roles.

 **The skills you bring:**

* A Master’s or Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar.
* Excellent skills in software programming languages, preferably Java and JavaScript/TypeScript as well as in industry standard frameworks like Java EE, OSGi, Angular etc.
* Good knowledge of development environments and tools like Jira, Git, Gerrit, Maven, Jenkins etc.
* Knowledgeable in containerization & cloud technics.
* A creative soul who loves finding new paths, innovations and solutions.
* Leadership skills in the sense of being brave enough to take full responsibility for your
* area of tasks and personal development, and in the long run also for the team or the complete product.
* A positive and inspiring approach to your everyday work and teammates.
* Strong teamwork skills.
* Proficiency in English, since we are a big player in the global environment.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Karlskrona

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*
**In brief**
 At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery, we are building the next generation investment platform.
   

  

**This is part of the role**
 Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a developer at Nordnet, you will have the possibility to make an impact and create value for our customers with continuous releases several times a day.
   

  

**This is you**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you take great pride in your work, are curious and continuously want to learn and grow. Collaboration and discussing ideas and concepts with your colleagues are things you enjoy and believe are important in order to build great products.
   

  

**As a Backend Software Engineer, You**
* Have experience of modern Java and Spring Boot
* Have experience of cloud development
* Have an interest in infrastructure as code and preferably experience in DevOps
* Design, develop, deploy and run Java services following good design and development practices
* Find the customer's importance and appreciate working closely together within a pure backend team, with stakeholders across the organization as well as outside 3rd-party vendors.
* Are a true team player that likes to share knowledge with your colleagues
* Love to automate, especially when it comes to testing
* Experience in high-performing, low-latency systems are preferred


 In this particular role, we believe you have an interest in savings and investments, and if you have worked in similar areas, it is even better.
   

  

**Nordnetters**
* Are proud of the friendly and humble environment
* Believe that the best code is written together and therefore appreciate pair/mob programming
* Continuously improve to ensure quality, making the code better with every release
* Commit to goals as a team, sharing the responsibility, success and failure


**What We Offer**
* Backend agile team which owns and maintains their product
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as an engineer
* Competitive salary and compensation


 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. Our teams are autonomous and embrace the agile way of working.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 Visit us on: www.nordnetab.com and https://career.nordnetab.com/pages/engineering
   

  

**Questions & applications**
 Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: .Net Developer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for you who want to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
 About the role:
   

  

 Are you a skilled .NET developer who believes a team is stronger than any individual? Join us on our journey to modernize — while keeping today’s systems running smoothly.
   

  

 As a .NET developer, you will be part of a team responsible for maintaining and supporting business-critical applications, many of which are essential to our day-to-day operations. At the same time, you will contribute to the gradual modernization of our technology stack.
   

  

 You will work primarily with backend development in .NET, ensuring the stability and performance of existing systems. While your main focus will be on maintenance and improvement of current solutions, you will also have the opportunity to participate in developing new technical capabilities. Experience in frontend development is a plus, as we collaborate closely with teams working on our digital interfaces.
   

  

 If you are motivated by maintaining business critical systems while helping shape the path forward, we would like to connect with you.
   

  

 You will also get the opportunity to work in an multiculture and dynamic environment together with our development center in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Who we are looking for:**
 To thrive in this role we believe you have experience with:
   

  

* .NET / .NET Core (multiple versions)
* MS SQL, MongoDB
* REST API / Web service
* C#
* Git
* Great communication skills and fluency in Swedish and English


**This could be the right place for you if you have:**
* The drive and engagement to take part in our current solution modernization journey
* The desire to work with development, implementation, and maintenance
* Capability to take ownership of the team’s applications


**People would describe you as:**
* Someone who builds positive relationships
* A team player who believes a team is stronger than an individual
* An experienced developer
* A problem solver


**It would be great if you also had experience in:**
* Containerization / Microservices (Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Kafka)
* Front-end development
* Blazor
* Azure DevOps
* GCP


 Additional Information
   

  

**Start:** 
 Immediately
   

  

**Working hours:** 
 100%
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months of probationary employment
   

  

**Note:** 
***Please apply only if you are currently based in Sweden.***

title: Fullstack Developer to MittVaccin
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1100 employees in several countries.*
*Since 2012, MittVaccin has been a pioneer in digital service development for residents and healthcare providers within both the private and public healthcare sectors. Since 2020, we are Cambio MittVaccin, and as a member of Cambio, our innovation and digitalization of vaccination services have accelerated. With the trust of 13 regions and 350 healthcare providers with clinics in over 220 municipalities in Sweden's all 21 regions, we have a nationwide presence, continuously striving to improve the interaction between vaccinators and residents. MittVaccin is the singlest largest source of vaccination information in Sweden supporting not only its many healthcare providers but also national reporting and information sharing. Our work increases awareness, knowledge, and accessibility to vaccinations. In this way, we aim to drive demand for patient-safe and efficient vaccination management in Sweden, ultimately benefiting both public health and society’s protection against serious diseases* 
*.*
**The position**
 As a Fullstack Developer with us, you will have the opportunity to work on and develop Sweden's most modern and well-established digital vaccination platform – MittVaccin; both the EHR system and the Inhabitant service mittvaccin.se and related solution components. You will be part of a dynamic and agile organization with global ambitions. Every team member is an essential link in the chain, and each person has significant individual responsibility and the opportunity to shape their role. You will see firsthand how your development work contributes to public benefit and preventive healthcare for all.
   

  

 In this role, you will work on the development, design, and architecture of both our frontend and backend, with a primary focus on backend. You will also be involved in technical investigations as part of your work. Together with the development team—comprising system developers, solution architects, product owners, and others—you will drive the development of MittVaccin Journal and MittVaccin Citizen Service forward.
   

  

 The focus is on new development and building from scratch rather than pure maintenance. Key requirements for the services include scalability, performance, regulatory compliance, medical safety, and self-service functionality. The development team works agilely using Kanban and Scrum in sprints, with multiple service releases each year. You will participate in sprint planning alongside product owners and the rest of the development team.
   

  

 Our workplace is characterized by modern and coaching leadership, respect, inclusion, transparency, personal ownership, flexibility, continuous improvement, and a strong commitment to caring for each other as colleagues and human beings.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 You are passionate about finding the best solutions for our customers, have a pedagogical approach, and find it interesting to deepen your understanding of various healthcare processes and needs—translating them into technical solutions. You work independently with strong self-motivation but also thrive when collaborating with your team members or customers.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* 5+ years of experience as a full-stack developer
* Strong proficiency in SQL (including stored programs, views, and performance optimization)
* Extensive knowledge of PHP and PHPUnit, including object-oriented frameworks
* Experience with JavaScript and React or similar libraries
* Knowledge of API design and development
* Experience in requirements gathering, architecture/design, and development infrastructure
* Solid experience working with agile methodologies, such as Scrum and Kanban
* Experience working with IT/development in swedish healthcare, providing an understanding of relevant laws and regulations affecting system design
* Ability to communicate fluently in Swedish, as it is required for daily communication.


**It's a bonus if you have**
* Experience with some of the following: MySQL, Apache, Redis, Docker or Git
* Experience with clustered environments and load balancing for web applications
* Experience with API technologies such as SOAP and REST
* Experience using standards and reference models for healthcare informatics and interoperability, such as FHIR, OpenEHR, Snomed-CT, ICD, KVÅ, and related regulatory frameworks for information management
* Experience working with IT/development in healthcare, giving you an understanding of the laws and regulations that impact system design


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in
 **Sweden.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: C# Developer
description:
**👨‍💻** 
**C# Developer**
 🚀 About MSAB
   

  

 We believe that you are dreaming of using your technical skills and your innovative mindset to create a better democratic world. Especially by solving crimes, gathering intelligence, investigating fraud and fighting corruption. At MSAB we make that dream come true!
   

  

 MSAB is one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies. We develop digital forensic solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used globally. Working with programming you will perform demanding tasks that tickles your innovative mindset and challenge your technical skills to find your way forward towards a solution.
   

  

**🛠️** 
**Your Role**
 As a C# Developer, you will:
   

  

* Develop and maintain desktop applications using C# .NET and WPF.
* Write unit and integration tests, utilizing Docker.
* Participate in daily Kanban meetings, backlog grooming, and retrospectives.
* Collaborate on architectural discussions and application development strategies.


**👥** 
**Meet the XEC Team**
**Join Our Dynamic XEC Team, Comprising**
* 4 Developers
* 1 Tester
* 1 UX Designer
* 1 Product Manager


**Together, We Develop And Maintain MSAB's Frontline Products, Including**
* XRY Kiosk and Tablet: User-friendly tools for mobile device data extraction.
* XEC Director: A centralized management solution for overseeing connected client systems.


**🎯** 
**What We're Looking For**
**Must-Haves**
* We don’t hire mediocre developers, we hire top talent who know they are very good and strive to unleash their full potential together with your amazing peers
* Strong understanding of Windows desktop application development.
* Minimum of 3 years' experience in C# development.
* Willingness to work with and modernize legacy code.
* Fluency in Swedish or excellent proficiency in English.
* University-level education in software development or equivalent experience.


**Nice-to-Haves**
* Experience with client-server communication (WCF or similar technologies).
* Knowledge of gRPC.
* Proficiency in SQL Server (T-SQL).
* Familiarity with the MVVM pattern in WPF.
* Understanding of cloud technologies and services.
* Experience with agile methodologies, particularly Kanban.


**Personal Attributes**
* Team player with a collaborative mindset.
* Open-minded and adaptable to various coding practices.
* We are nerds, and to like it here it’s always a + to have specific interests that may not be common to common people


**🌍** 
**What We Offer**
 Join a company that's making a real difference. At MSAB, you'll find a collaborative environment, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to be part of a mission that matters. We are working in a hybrid office model so you can meet your peers as well as working from home.
   

  

 MSAB is a world leader in forensic technology for extracting and analyzing data from mobile devices. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions for a safer world.
   

  

 MSAB deliver high quality digital forensic solutions to extract, review, analyze and manage data and are a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defense Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption. Our values encompass being an ethics-driven company focused on innovation and results.

title: Fullstack / Frontend Developer - Planning and Solution Design
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack Developer, you’ll play a central role in one of our product teams, within Aira’s Acquisition area. The focus of these teams is to craft web applications at the heart of Aira’s energy solution design and installation planning systems. These applications are fundamental to achieving a world-class customer experience and span across tools for designing the solutions, as well as planning and scheduling the installations. The team develops data products for modeling Aira's field force optimization as well as the tools to support installers on-site, at the customers' homes.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Proficiency in frontend development, particularly with React & Typescript.
* Experience in automated testing to ensure application reliability and performance
* Experience writing backends in a classical object-oriented language like C# or Java


 We would also expect you to have experience in at least two of the following areas:
   

  

  

* Writing backend code in Java and Spring Boot
* Databases (e.g. DynamoDB/PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (AWS, Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes)
* gRPC and protobuf


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy working in our brand new office. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan subway station just a few minutes walk away.


 Aira leads in the next generation of Energy. We are driven by our belief that the power of diversity fuels innovation. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team, united in our mission to create a better future for society and the planet.

description:

Du får bryta ner komplexa problem och skapa anpassade lösningar till kunder med den allra senaste tekniken, med grund i Microsofts hela portfölj av tjänster. Som utvecklare i .NET rör vi oss över hela stacken, vilket gör att arbetsuppgifterna under en vecka kan variera. Att arbeta med Microsofts paraply av molntjänster, som dessutom ständigt utökas, gör att du kan bli specialist inom ditt kompetensområde, men ändå alltid ha mer att lära.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna som utvecklare hos oss kan t.ex. innebära att:

* Skapa .NET Core-applikationer för att integrera till och från Dynamics CRM

**Varför välja Sopra Steria**
* Fokus på kompetensutveckling och din personliga utveckling - vi kallar det för Power of sharing

**Ytterligare information**

Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Core system developer
description:
Trygg-Hansa Affinity is an integrated department of leading insurance group in the Nordics - Tryg. Affinity’s focus has expanded from electronic devices into Payment Protection Insurance, Cancellation, ID Protection and other insurance categories within the Affinity space and we have active distribution partners and operations across all the Nordic countries.
   

  

**The position**
 Affinity is transitioning its core system from Winsure to Guidewire and is seeking an experienced developer to join this transformation. As a core system developer, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain our core system. You will be part of an agile team of IT developers and System Business Developers.
   

  

**In This Position You Will**
* customize and configure Guidewire software to meet business requirements, such as integrating with legacy systems and ensuring data consistency.
* troubleshoot, debug, and resolve technical issues and challenges.
* participate in the full software development life cycle, from planning and design to development, testing, and deployment.
* stay up to date with industry best practices and trends related to Guidewire development, and apply this knowledge to overcome challenges such as implementing new features and maintaining system security.


 The role is placed in Stockholm and permanent work permit in Sweden is required.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To excel in this role, we are looking for an experienced IT professional, preferably with knowledge in the insurance sector. The ideal candidate will have proven expertise in Guidewire development. You should possess excellent problem-solving and be capable of working both independently and as part of a team.
   

  

 To be successful in this role we see that you have:
   

  

* bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
* proven experience in Guidewire and also certified
* knowledge with Guidewire cloud
* strong programming skills in Java or other relevant languages
* experience in Integrating application by using REST API/WebServices (SOAP) using ProxyGen.
* experience in version control tool like Team Foundation Server (TFS), Visual SourceSafe (VSS), SVN, GIT.


**Application**
 Welcome to apply via the link. As the recruitment is ongoing, please send your application as soon as possible but no later than 30th of april. For questions about the position, please contact recruiting manager Jasmina Suojoki Olsson on +46 70- 870 51 35 or via email jasmina.suojoki@trygghansa.se. Final candidates will be subject to a background check.
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

 We kindly decline any contact from advertisement, consultant and recruitment companies.
   

  

**Union representatives**
 Akademikerföreningen: Lena Darin, 070-168 28 44
   

  

 Forena: Elias Bakk, 0707-306854
   

  

**En trygg arbetsplats**
 Vi sätter människan och mångfald i fokus och är övertygade om att samarbete och olika perspektiv skapar de bästa förutsättningarna för utveckling. Hos oss blir du en del av ett team med kunniga och nyfikna kollegor och en inkluderande arbetsplats med ett stort hjärta.
   

  

 Vi uppmuntrar därför alla, oavsett kön, ålder, ursprung eller bakgrund, att söka tjänsten.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på Trygg-Hansa
   

  

 Vi hänger på din utvecklingsresa om du är med på vår
   

  

 Hos oss är utveckling och lärande något som ständigt pågår – och vi vill att du växer. Vi ser det som en stark motivationskraft att du vill dela med dig av din kunskap och erfarenhet för att på så sätt både inspirera och utvecklas tillsammans med dina kollegor, kunder och partners.
   

  

 Oavsett vad som driver dig är vi där och stöttar dig under din utvecklingsresa hos oss.
   

  

 Utforska dina möjligheter här
   

  

**Är våra kännetecken också dina?**
 Visa tillit
   

  

 Hos Trygg-Hansa bygger vi på varandras tillit när vi rör oss ut på okänd mark som morgondagens trygghetsskapare. Vi tror att tillit och frihet under ansvar motiverar din nyfikenhet och ditt mod att gå nya vägar. Du får ledare och kollegor som lägger vikt vid både trivsel och resultat.
   

  

 Hos Trygg-Hansa upplever du en kultur som bygger på tillit, samspel och utveckling hela vägen runt.
   

  

 Ta ansvar
   

  

 När du börjar på Trygg-Hansa kommer du snabbt att upptäcka att ansvar är något som betyder mycket. Ju mer ansvar du vill ha, desto mer får du när du visar att du kan leva upp till det.
   

  

 Här får du mandat att utforska nya möjligheter, koncept och lösningar som skapar trygghet för kunder, kollegor och samhälle idag och imorgon.
   

  

 Skapa utveckling
   

  

 På Trygg-Hansa går du i spetsen och skapar utvecklingen tillsammans med dina kollegor. Det kräver både mod, vilja och förmågan att gå nya vägar. Vi kämpar varje dag för att utveckla vår position som en av Nordens största trygghetsskapare.
   

  

 Det ger stora möjligheter för dig som kan, vill och vågar sätta fart på din egen och företagets utveckling.

title: Software Developer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
 Nu söker vi Stockholms bästa utvecklare till vårt affärsområde Financial Services. Här bygger vi smarta lösningar som hjälper Sveriges företagare med finansiering och att få betalt för sina tjänster. Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du därför att få arbeta med att utveckla de tjänster som gör oss till Sveriges mest spännande fintech-bolag. Du kommer att ingå i ett mindre team som tar stort ansvar för design och användbarhet av lösningar. Vi arbetar agilt och du kommer att få vara med och påverka arbetssätt, metoder och tekniker vilket ger dig stora möjligheter att utvecklas genom hela teknikstacken. Tillsammans med andra utvecklare, produktägare och testare tar ni affärsområdet Financial Services till nästa nivå.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
* Har ett genuint intresse för programmering, drivs av utmanande uppgifter och att förbättra användarupplevelsen för våra kunder!
* Har några års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling.
* Besitter goda kunskaper i moderna programmeringstekniker. Du bör ha några års erfarenhet av Java/Kotlin.
* Är flytande i svenska i såväl tal som skrift


 För att trivas i denna roll ser vi att du är lösningsorienterad och att du trivs med att jobba i en föränderlig miljö. Du är trygg i din kompetens, är självgående och tar gärna lead på kontinuerlig förbättring av metoder, verktyg och leveranser. Du håller dig uppdaterad om relevanta tekniker och verktyg, deltar i teambeslut och sprider gärna vidare din kunskap till dina kollegor på Fortnox.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Techstack: Java/Kotlin, React, Postgres, Bitbucket/Github
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i ett självgående men sammansvetsat team. Vi träffas ofta och gärna och samarbetar både strategiskt och operativt med team inom samma område. Vi tror på flexibilitet och att arbeta på distans, samtidigt som vi vill erbjuda en kreativ arbetsmiljö för våra medarbetare. Vi sitter i fina lokaler på Linnégatan 89 i Stockholm och träffas på kontoret 3 dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Om Fortnox**
*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* 
*www.fortnox.se* 
*.*
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
