title: Consultant
description:
Gothenburg
4.5-8 Years
Sweden
**No. of Positions**


1
**Job Description (Posting).**

We are a $13+ billion global technology company, home to more than 224,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud, and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products.  

  

HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we’ve never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We’ve always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments —no matter how big or small —can be traced back to an idea’s single spark.  

  

It’s that spark —that inner drive —that sets our people apart from our competitors. It enables us not just to pull off game-changing feat after game-changing feat but to better our world in the process. We want you to find your spark. Because that’s what drives you to be better, be more and ultimately, be more fulfilled.  

  

**Role definition**  

  

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Network Architect to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for relevant hands-on technical expertise in installation, configuration, maintenance of network devices in enterprise infrastructure environments WAN and SDWAN Environment.  

  

  

  

**Job Responsibilities:*** 6 to 10 years of relevant hands-on technical expertise in installation, configuration, maintenance of network devices in enterprise infrastructure environments.
* WAN /SDWAN - Cisco Routing, MPLS, Internet VPN technologies, ISR, ASR 9k platforms.
* Working knowledge in Meraki, SD-WAN is an added advantage.
* LAN - Cisco Switching Campus Catalyst Switches, Datacenter – Nexus 5k, 7k platforms, Cisco ACI etc
* WLAN - Cisco WLCs, Aironet APs,
* Load-balancing – F5
* Cisco Certifications are preferred – CCNP , CCIE ( Routing/Switching/ Datacenter).
* Proven relevant experience working in projects, able to deliver services in strict time schedules.
* Able to comprehend business needs into IT deliverables.

  

**Skills required:*** Keeping documentation (LLD, As-is service/contract view and underlying products) related to the corresponding Technical Area up to date.
* Interact with Operations and proactively highlight different risks (Technical , Process) related to the specific Technical area.
* Go to person for operations team for any technical clarifications around specific service/products.
* Collaborate with Domain Architect to understand HLD and also provide Subject Matter Expertise.
* Creating Low level design document and rollout Plan for one or more Projects. Oversee and provide Technical governance during project execution.
* Follow architecture and security principles , processes, Target Architecture guidelines in designing new solutions.
* Attend different forums based on the project certification requirements and present solutions(Need based).
* Support Domain and portfolio architects with technical inputs for Roadmap creation with in specific technical area.
* Functionally responsible towards Architecture office and ensure mandates are followed in totality

  

**Benefits*** A supportive, diverse and global team with a brilliant culture.
* Competitive compensation and benefits that includes up to 20 days’ vacation per year, various insurances like Term life, AD &D and Business Travel insurance. These are apart from the statutory benefits applicable in the country.
* Great opportunities to make the role your own, upskill yourself and get involved with exciting projects
* Total Wellbeing is our focus. Alongside your professional excellence, you join the likeminded colleagues to create a larger impact within the company and society at large in your chosen area of passion - CSR Council, Diversity Council, Sparks – Engagement Champion to name a few.
* To know more about us visit – www.hcltech.com

title: Hjärnfonden söker en grafisk formgivare
description:
**O****m Hjärnfonden**


Hjärnfonden arbetar för ett samhälle där alla hjärnor når sin fulla potential, fria från sjukdomar. Det är genom att bidra till forskning som vi kan förändra livet för ännu fler människor.


Sedan vår start 1994 har vi delat ut över en miljard kronor till svensk hjärnforskning och vi har inga planer på att sakta ner. Det finns mycket mer att utforska. Vi vet att förändring i det stora börjar med att ge varje människa rätt förutsättningar. Att varje människa, varje hjärna, får plats.


För att uppfylla vår vision arbetar vi med ändamålen: insamling och finansiering av hjärnforskning samt kunskapsspridning och opinionsbildning för hjärnans område.


Hjärnfonden är en betydelsefull finansiär av forskning inom neurovetenskapens alla områden – från grundforskning till klinisk forskning. Vi tror på att gemensamt skapa livsviktiga lösningar genom forskning, för fler. Målet är ökad kunskap och fler genombrott på hjärnans och nervsystemets område.


I dag är Hjärnfonden en av Sveriges snabbast växande insamlingsorganisationer men vi är långt ifrån färdiga. När vi lägger kraft bakom forskning, sprider kunskap och bryter stigman förändrar vi livet för fler.


Tillsammans fortsätter vi att sätta hjärnan på agendan för att driva utvecklingen till ett samhälle där alla förstår hjärnans betydelse och potential.


Vill du vara med?

**Om rollen**


Hjärnfonden söker en grafisk formgivare som med kreativitet, nytänkande och ett öga för detaljer vill bidra till vårt arbete för ett samhälle där alla hjärnor når sin fulla potential, fria från sjukdomar.


Hos oss kommer du att arbeta brett med både digitala och tryckta kanaler, säkerställa att vår grafiska profil håller hög kvalitet i alla sammanhang och fortsätta utveckla och lyfta vår prisbelönta visuella identitet.


Som grafisk formgivare blir du en viktig del av vårt marknad- och kommunikationsteam. Du arbetar nära vår kreativt ansvariga samt i löpande samarbete med de flesta i teamet, övriga avdelningar och externa leverantörer.  

Marknad och kommunikationsavdelningen består idag av 9 medarbetare samt ett antal konsulter.

  

Du kommer bland annat att:

* Skapa och granska grafiskt material för såväl digitala kanaler som tryckta
* Säkerställa att den grafiska profilen följs och håller en enhetlig och hög visuell standard i all kommunikation, både internt och externt
* Utveckla, korrigera och anpassa material i olika kanaler
* Delta i kreativa processer och bidra med idéer till kampanjer och kommunikationsinsatser
* Samarbeta med övriga avdelningar och bidra med grafiskt stöd i hela organisationen

**Om dig**


Du har en relevant utbildning inom grafisk design eller motsvarande. Efter dina studier ser vi att du har arbetat ett par år. Vi arbetar dagligen i Adobe Creative Cloud och förväntar oss att du har mycket goda kunskaper i programmen.


Utöver dina kompetenser och erfarenheter ser vi att du har lätt för att ta egna initiativ, gillar att utveckla idéer och är trygg i att självgående driva ditt arbete framåt, samtidigt som du värdesätter samarbete och kreativ dialog. Vidare ser vi att rollen och våra arbetssätt ställer krav på att du kan ta eget ansvar, är noggrann och kommunikativ.

  

* God samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team
* Öga för detaljer, designhantverk och estetik
* Meriterande: grundläggande kunskap inom foto och film, erfarenhet av Figma, WordPress och/eller innehållsskapande för sociala medier

**Övrigt**


Välkommen till en av Sveriges snabbast växande insamlingsorganisationer där du får bidra till ett samhälle där alla hjärnor ska få nå sin fulla potential, fria från hjärnans sjukdomar, och arbeta med andra som brinner för detta. Hjärnfonden arbetar med insamling och finansiering av hjärnforskning samt kunskapsspridning och opinionsbildning för hjärnans område. Vår arbetsplats präglas av frihet under ansvar och vi vill också ge dig som medarbetare möjlighet att fördjupa och bredda din kunskap. Hållbara arbetssätt är en ledstjärna på Hjärnfonden, vi erbjuder träning på arbetstid, friskvårdsbidrag och andra fina förmåner för våra anställda. Tjänsten är på heltid och placerad i moderna och hjärnvänliga lokaler i Gamla Stan i centrala Stockholm. Du rapporterar till vår Marknad-och kommunikationschef. Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.

title: Next-Gen Development Manager / Service Owner sökes till...
description:
*Är du redo att leda utvecklingen av nästa generations lönesystem och låsa upp din framtid? Brinner du för innovation och att utveckla banbrytande produkter inom IT? Har du erfarenhet av att leda medarbetare till framgång och vill vara med på en resa som redan idag revolutionerar lön- och HR-system?*

*Då ser vi fram emot din ansökan som Development Manager på Visma Enterprise!*

 **Om oss**

  

Visma Enterprise AB är en del av Visma-koncernen - Skandinaviens ledande IT-koncern med över 15 000 anställda. Vi står i spetsen för att skapa cloud-lösningar inom HRM och WFM som förenklar och effektiviserar både privat och offentlig sektor i Sverige,våra samhällskritiska system skapar oöverträffade användarupplevelser för tiotusentals slutanvändare varje dag. Nu behöver vi dig för att ta ytterligare nästa steg!

 **Om rollen**

  

Som Development Manager kommer du att leda arbetet med vår toppmoderna, molnbaserade löneplattform *Payroller*, en flaggskeppsprodukt. Samt leda ett högpresterande team med utvecklare, testare, Business Analysts och arkitekt, där du ges möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken i en flexibel microservices arkitektur. Data-drivna insikter är av största vikt för oss, och det blir således ditt uppdrag att på alla fronter vidareutveckla Payroller, vår “born in the cloud" -lösning för att säkerställa dess marknadsledande läge även för framtiden.


Vi arbetar i enlighet med Visma Cloud Delivery Model – ett ramverk designat för våra mest moderna produkter – där våra processer för snabbfotad utveckling, automatiserad testning och helt automatiserat deployflöde leder till en riktigt effektiv utveckling och hög kvalitet. Du kommer ha möjligheten att se dina idéer omsättas i produktion inom loppet av timmar, snarare än veckor, vilket inte bara är unikt, utan även bidrar till en dynamisk och engagerande arbetsmiljö.

 **Vad blir dina ansvarsområden?**

* Leda ett högpresterande team med utvecklare, testare, Business Analysts och arkitekt.
* Utveckla och förbättra våra processer och tekniker för en"born in the cloud” produkt.
* Driva projekt i hela kedjan - business analytics, utveckling och deploy för att leverera en lösning som alltid sätter användaren i fokus.
* Främja innovation och säkerställa att produktsäkerheten och kvaliteten alltid ligger på högsta nivå.

 **Vem söker vi?**


Du har en gedigen bakgrund inom produktutveckling, vi lägger stor vikt vid dina tekniska färdigheter och ser således att en bagrund som arkitekt eller senior utvecklare är fördelaktigt. Det innebär att du besitter förmågan att omsätta information från kunder, kollegor och teamet till bra lösningar. Du behöver även ha kapacitet att leda med positiv energi och engagera ditt team mot gemensamma mål, driva strategiska initiativ och övervaka marknadsläget löpande. Vidare utgår vi från att du tidigare har arbetat med komplexa produkter och har en förmåga att inspirera och motivera dina medarbetare i hela kedjan - i allt från från business analytics, arkitektur, utveckling, test till deploy. Vi tror att du som person är en bra kommunikatör, samtidigt prestigelös, och alltid ser möjligheter i problem och agerar därefter. Slutligen tror vi att du besitter mycket goda kunskaper i både engelska och svenska, samt att du har en relevant högskoleutbildning, eller likvärdiga kunskaper förvärvade på annat vis.  

  

  



**Vad erbjuder vi på Visma dig?**

* Möjlighet att arbeta med cutting-edge teknik i en högkompetent miljö.
* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor vad beträffar lön, semester, pension och friskvård.
* En hybrid arbetsmodell där du tillåts jobbat både hemifrån och från ett av våra moderna kontorsutrymmen.
* Stora möjligheter att påverka och forma båda dina egna framtidsmöjligheter samt framtidens digitala lösningar.


Lås upp din framtid hos Visma Enterprise och bli en del av vår framåtlutade och välkomnande kultur där innovation och utveckling alltid står i centrum.

 **Ansökan**


Vi kommer löpande att utvärdera ansökningar och kalla till intervju. Dröj därmed inte med att skicka in dina ansökan redan idag, eller vid frågor kontakta:  

  

Mikko Keinonen • Product Development Director • Visma Enterprise AB


mikko.keinonen@visma.com


+46702801998


Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig på vår resa!

title: Mobile App Platform Engineer - React Native
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of banks, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*

**In brief**  

  

At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery we are building the next generation investment platform.

 **This is part of the role**  

  

Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a developer at Nordnet you will have the possibility to make an impact and create value to our customers with continuous releases several times a week.  

  

**This is you**


To thrive in this role, we believe that you love to contribute to a state-of-the-art developer experience and to work on improving and modernizing our mobile technology stack. You can easily connect with people, have a solution-oriented mindset and are happy to help and support others.

**As a mobile app platform engineer, you:**

* Are confident in mobile development. Our tech stack includes JavaScript/TypeScript, React Native, Redux, RTK Query, Testing library, MSW, React Navigation, GitHub actions and Expo
* Have a birds eye perspective when setting the architecture for the future
* Are motivated when faced with complex technical problems
* Are eager to automate things

**A bonus is if you:**

* Are knowledgeable in Java and Terraform
* Are interested or have experience with the rest of the tech stack, which includes GCP, Nginx, Docker, Kubernetes and ArgoCD

**Nordnetters**

* Are proud of the friendly and humble environment
* Believe that the best code is written together and therefore appreciate pair/mob programming
* Continuously improving to ensure quality, making the code better with every release
* Commit to our goals as a team, sharing the responsibility, success and failure

**What we offer**

* Experienced team which build own products and support other teams and products
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as an engineer
* Competitive salary and compensation
* Flexible work setup (from office or hybrid)


We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. We are embracing the agile way of working. Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do. We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen. Visit us on: **www.nordnetab.com**  

  

**Questions & applications**  

  

Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered. We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.  

We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Corporate Finance and Controlling Manager
description:
**Introducing evroc**


At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud and AI services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.

**Location:** Stockholm

**Job type:** Permanent position

**Join the Pioneers**


From day one, you'll be involved in not only running the day-to-day tasks at hand, but also be part of shaping the success of the company into the future. You will be working both with day-to-day activities such as following up revenue, costs, and investments, and with strategic matters including preparation and execution of capital raises, due diligence, devising financial and informing corporate strategy.


You are driven by the unique challenges these requirements present, with a proven ability to define, develop and implement robust plans on sound recommendations that supports the overarching target – to be Europe's hyperscale provider of choice.


You bring extensive experience from similar challenges, have a strong general understanding of how commercial and financial matters are linked together. We are looking for a well rounded candidate, comfortable in many areas, rather than a specialist. You’ll be based in our head office in Stockholm, but may be required to travel to our offices in London, UK and Sophia Antipolis, France, and other places.

**What You'll Tackle**

* Financial modelling and strategy, both for the company and for specific projects
* Capital acquisition projects both on the equity and debt
* Analyzing capital expenditures and ensuring a strong control of investments
* Revenue / cost controlling and modelling – both at company, product, and project level
* Liquidity forecasting
* Understanding and informing on product profitability
* Owning and developing evrocs key KPI´s

**Skills We Value**

* We expect the right candidate for this role to have 5+ years of experience from leadership roles in business/financial controlling.
* Experience from fast-growing organizations, equity and debt raising
* Experience from SaaS, development-intense, fixed assets settings
* Very good communicator both verbally and in written material
* Strong communication skills
* Proficiency in English and French is a merit


You will report to the CFO of evroc but have frequent interactions across the larger organization to succeed in your role.


We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!  

  

At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.

title: Senior FinOps Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.


Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**  

In our Cloud Governance team, we are seeking an experienced Senior FinOps Engineer to accelerate the interaction with engineering stakeholders. This role will drive FinOps maturity towards full cost attribution and unit metrics, focusing on automations, tool integrations, prototyping solutions, and developing metadata strategies. The candidate will play a crucial role in mapping our application stack to cost and optimizing cloud expenditure. While this role has a focus on FinOps, other data or cloud governance responsibilities will be part of the job, ensuring comprehensive management practices. Those with a passion for innovation and cloud cost efficiency are encouraged to apply.


Responsibilities

* Collaborate with engineering stakeholders to improve FinOps maturity and implement cost-effective solutions.
* Develop and apply automation frameworks to streamline financial operations and enhance efficiency.
* Use cloud cost management tools to optimize cloud spending.
* Promote FinOps practices to raise cost awareness and efficiency across the organization.
* Create prototypes to test strategies for cost attribution and unit metrics.
* Improve FinOps efficiencies by utilizing automations to reduce manual intervention and enhance real-time cost monitoring and management.
* Map the application stack to cost, ensuring transparent and accurate cost allocation.
* Develop and execute metadata strategies to enhance data quality and manage costs effectively.
* Stay informed about the latest cloud technologies and cost optimization strategies.
* Support the development of frameworks for comprehensive cost attribution and unit metrics.
* Assist in improving the organization's financial health and efficiency through data-driven decisions.
* Encourage a cost-efficient architecture mindset that optimizes costs while maintaining performance and reliability.


If you are passionate about optimizing cloud costs, driving innovation, and contributing to the financial health and efficiency of our organization, we invite you to apply for the FinOps Engineer role. Join us in shaping the future of cloud governance and financial operations at a leading cloud-native company.


This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

 **Qualifications**  

Basic Qualifications

* Several years of experience in a FinOps Engineer role or similar position, or as a Data Analyst or Software Engineer with exposure to FinOps and a desire to deepen their expertise.
* Strong technical skills in cloud technologies, including experience with AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
* Excellent verbal and written communication abilities


Preferred Qualifications

* Proficiency in using cloud cost management tools such as Cloudability or CloudHealth would be good.
* Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and drive actionable insights.
* Experience in automation, tool integration, prototyping solutions, and metadata strategies.
* Proficient in Scripting, Terraform, and modern software development practices.
* Solid understanding of cost drivers and financial principles in a cloud environment.
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with various stakeholders across the organization.
* FinOps certifications or a willingness to obtain them.

  

**Additional Information**  

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Business Manager, Medical Oncology (m/w/d)
description:
Warsaw - EBS, Poland
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**

We're on the hunt for an experienced Business Manager, Medical Oncology (m/w/d) who will work in the Life Sciences and Data Partnerships function of the Business Line Oncology Software Solutions A successful candidate will be responsible for driving the uptake of medical oncology sites through proactive and independent lead generation and joint engagement with Elekta’s life sciences partners, supporting Life Sciences companies’ global and local teams to enable successful introduction of Elekta’s solutions to medical oncology sites, and to support life sciences and data partnerships team in driving new clinic sales.

**What you’ll do at Elekta**


The Business Manager, Medical Oncology (m/w/d) responsibilities include (but are not limited to):


Customer facing responsibilities:

* Conducts medical oncology sales in European markets
* Works with global and local affiliates of pharmaceutical companies to identify strategic opportunities on a regional, national or account level, and through that helping to accelerate the adoption of Elekta’s SW solutions (e.g. Kaiku) at medical oncology sites
* Responsible for end-to-end sales from identifying a leads (alone and together with pharmaceutical companies) to closing a deal (e.g. introducing Kaiku to new customers, answering customers’ questions, drafting and negotiating contracts)
* Interacts with life sciences partners, follows up on their leads, and supports them with their internal sales-related training programs


Internally facing responsibilities:

* Shares order updates with the Kaiku life sciences and data teams about Medical Oncology site engagement
* Participates in different activities to develop pharma site engagement and pharma sales
* Continuously improves internal processes and outputs to support Kaiku sales
* Keeps the organization up to date on ongoing and upcoming strategic opportunities with pharma partners


This is a customer-facing role, which includes travel when needed, likely 50% of time.

**What you’ll bring**

* Education in business, economics, technology or a similar field (e.g. a degree from a university or a university of applied sciences)
* 5+ years of demonstrable track record in sales or business development of cloud-based software
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills
* Excellent command of basic office software
* Good project management skills

**What you’ll get**

In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this, Elekta offers a range of benefits depending on the location where you apply.

**Hiring process**

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.

**Your Elekta contact**

For questions, please contact Global Talent Acquisition Partner responsible Joanna Kozyra on Joanna.kozyra@elekta.com


**We are an equal opportunity employer**

We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic

title: Integration Manager, Partners
description:
**Shape the Future of Payments with Nexi in 2025**  

Envision a world where every transaction feels effortless, safe, and connected. At Nexi, we’re leading this transformation, building tools and solutions that redefine how the world pays. By joining us, you’ll contribute to creating the next generation of digital payments in an innovative, supportive, and international environment.
  

  

**Why This Role Is Right for You**  

Join as an **Integration Manager** at a leading fintech company that's revolutionizing the payments industry. We are dedicated to **providing innovative card terminal solutions** that empower businesses worldwide. Our cutting-edge platforms and innovative Android terminals are redefining how merchants connect with their customers, and we're looking for an experienced and hands-on Integration manager, to help facilitate our partners and merchants to embark on this transformative journey


As an **Integration Manager** , you will be part of the team connecting **Electronic Cash Registers (ECRs)** and **large merchants** to Nexi terminals across various merchant environments. Your mission is to deeply understand their needs and challenges and offer them the best ways to connect and integrate with our diverse range of terminals.


You will work closely with external partners, merchants, as well as internal teams to deliver seamless, secure, and scalable integrations.
  

  

**About Your Future Role**  

In this position, you will:


* **Serve as the technical point of contact for ECR partners, merchants, and internal stakeholders** during all stages of the integration project,s providing expert guidance and support.
* Directly **execute integration tasks** , including **configuration, testing, deployment,** and **validation of payment terminal–ECR connectivity.**
* **Directly engage with ECR partners** and **large merchants** , to capture their specific needs, challenges, and objectives.
* **Set up test environments** , **simulate transaction flows** , and **validate end-to-end functionality** using tools like Postman, terminal debuggers, or logs.
* **Install or remotely configure payment terminal firmware** , communication settings (TCP/IP, Serial, USB), and software integrations as needed.
* **Lead technical troubleshooting** and **root-cause analysis** for any integration failures, performance issues, or edge cases.
* **Collaborate** closely with the product team to identify feature gaps or integration blockers, providing detailed feedback from real-world implementations.
* **Maintain accurate technical documentation** , flow diagrams, and partner-specific setup guides.
* Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions and training for internal support, engineering, and partner teams.

**What Makes You a Great Fit**  

We’re looking for someone eager to make a difference. Here’s what we value:
  

  

**Essential Qualifications:**

* **3-5 years proven experience in a hands-on technical integration role** in payments, fintech, or retail systems.
* Strong **working knowledge of ECR/POS systems** and **payment terminal APIs,** particularly in retail, restaurants, and inventory management solutions.
* **Android debugging skills** , with **hands-on experience using tools such as ADB, Logcat, and the Android Studio Profiler** from Android app installation to diagnose performance, crash, and connectivity issues.
* Strong **understanding of APIs** and **software integration** processes.
* Experience working with **Android applications and cloud-based APIs** .
* Proficiency in communication protocols
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to clearly communicate technical issues and solutions to customers and partners.
* High attention to detail, with a focus on delivering stable, secure, and compliant integrations

Even if you don’t check every box, **your unique potential and willingness to learn** could set you apart.


**What’s in it for you** ?


* **Attractive salary and a competitive benefits package** to reward your expertise and contributions
* **Tech equipment:** Get the tools you need to succeed, including the latest technology to support your work
* **Join an international team:** Collaborate with experts from across Europe and bring your ideas to life in a dynamic, global environment
* **Grow and develop:** Gain hands-on experience and structured training through our **PayTech University** , designed to accelerate your career and help you reach your full potential

**Discover Life at Nexi**  

We’re an international team of 10,000+ people across 25 countries, united by shared ambition and a passion for innovation. Learn more about our culture, Values, and how we’re shaping the future of digital payments. Visit our Life at Nexi page.


**Diversity and Inclusion at Nexi**  

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: together, we succeed by embracing our differences and creating a future where everyone can thrive.


**Your Next Step Starts Here**  

If this opportunity excites you, we’d love to hear your story. Submit your application today, and let’s shape the future of digital payments together!

**Discover Life at Nexi**  

We’re an international team of 10,000+ people across 25 countries, united by shared ambition and a passion for innovation. Learn more about our culture, Values, and how we’re shaping the future of digital payments. Visit our Life at Nexi page.

title: Sr Renewal Account Manager
description:
**Company Description**  

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description** **What you get to do in this role:**

* Partner with Sales to drive renewal strategy and manage renewal process across account territory.
* Take a lead role in negotiating all facets of renewal contracts - develop win/win negotiation strategies that maximize contract value while enhancing the customer relationship.
* Manage a complex territory/group of accounts to identify customer needs. Demonstrate account management capabilities to bring renewal to closure.
* Be an expert in ServiceNow licensing models to provide both sales and customers assistance in licensing discussions.
* Establish deeper customer health metrics to identify risk and guide risk mitigation strategies with the team.
* Provide regular and accurate forecasts on renewal business to management, anticipating risk factors.
* Create a rhythm around customers for multi-year contracts.
* Work with our Customer Success organization to promote customer product adoption and high use.
* Help increase sales enablement efforts regarding renewals topics
* Mentor more junior or new-to-role reps to help them be successful in Renewal
* Partner with Renewal Managers on driving programs to improve the effectiveness of the team and region.

  

**Qualifications** **To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* 10+ years demonstrated success in a Renewal Account Management or Customer Success capacity.
* Experience managing customer retention and adoption of a SaaS product for complex accounts/territories.
* Experience with the contract renewal process.
* Experience building relationships with peers and partners.
* Excellent customer management skills; including sales, account management, and customer service.
* Personal initiative to identify areas of process improvement and efficiency.
* Strong work ethic and quota achievement.
* Deep expertise with a SaaS model focused on enterprise software preferred.

  

FD21

 **Additional Information** **Work Personas**


We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**


For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

title: Data Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.


Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**  

The Data Infrastructure team at Visa Global Open Banking provides the infrastructure, tools, and pipelines needed to support our organization’s data-driven applications. Our mission is to ensure that data is collected, transformed, and presented in a secure, timely, reliable, and cost-efficient manner.


Key Responsibilities:

* Design, build, and maintain large-scale, cloud-based data services.
* Develop and maintain automated CI/CD pipelines and processes.
* Monitor and ensure the reliability and performance of the data infrastructure.
* Implement and enforce best practices for data security and compliance.
* Participate in an on-call rotation to support production systems.


If you are a talented and passionate Data Infrastructure Engineer looking for a new challenge, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team in central Stockholm!


This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.

 **Qualifications**  

* 5+ years of engineering experience.
* Proven success in designing, building, and managing large-scale, cloud-based services.
* Experience with containerization and orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Hands-on experience in an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) environment (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation).
* Proficiency in one or more programming languages, such as Java, Go, or Python.
* Experience with data warehouse tools (e.g., dbt, Apache Airflow).
* Strong understanding and experience with Cloud Security best practices.

  

**Additional Information**  

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.
