title: Network Security Engineer
description:
**About Norla:**  

Norla is an IT and management consulting company driven by customer satisfaction. We work in a multicultural environment and are guided by our principle of "Mind and Heart." We prioritize that our relationships with our employees ensure their professional growth and success. Together, we collaborate with a network of major actors to discover the best talents to support our clients.
  
  

As a Senior Network Security Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining advanced network security solutions. You will work across on-premises, Azure, and GCP environments, ensuring a secure and scalable network infrastructure.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Design and implement network segmentation strategies within data centers.
  
Deploy and manage Secure Service Edge (SSE) solutions such as Zscaler, Netskope, or similar platforms.
  
Configure and maintain IP-VPNs for secure communication, with a focus on hybrid environments (on-prem and Azure).
  
Manage firewall systems (e.g., Cisco ASA, Palo Alto), ensuring policies are up to date and secure.
  
Deploy and maintain Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS).
  
Troubleshoot and optimize network protocols, including TCP/IP, DNS, and HTTP/S.
  
Implement Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) principles across private, public (Azure/GCP), and on-prem networks.
  
  

Required Skills
  
Minimum 5 years of experience in network security engineering.
  
Expertise in network segmentation and security architecture design.
  
Strong experience with SSE platforms (e.g., Zscaler, Netskope).
  
Proven hands-on skills in IP-VPN setup and management.
  
Deep knowledge of firewalls, IDS/IPS systems, and network protocols.
  
Familiarity with Zero Trust frameworks, especially in hybrid and cloud-first environments.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**Here’s why this is a terrible job:**


This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.


We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.


If you need a few extra days to perfect your model, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.


We use tools like Cursor, OpenAI, and Gemini to prototype fast, test in prod, and push to users in hours—not quarters.


You’ll be operating at the intersection of large language models, user behavior, regulatory compliance, and structured knowledge graphs.


There are no clean datasets. No definitive papers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and noise from every direction.


You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work?


It is. And it’s not for everyone.


⸻

**Here's why it's the best career choice you'll make:**


We’re hyperscaling. We’re very well-funded. Generating very fast revenue, and have reached a strong product market fit score all within 9 months.


We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.


We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.


You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast.


And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.


You’ll ship models because you believe in them, not because they passed a review board.


You’ll talk to users weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.


We’ll tell you the goal. How you reach it—prompting, fine-tuning, embeddings, retrieval, structured data—is up to you.


We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so precise it can predict what a user will ask, before they even ask it.


That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


⸻

**The teammate we're looking for:**

* Thinks in probabilities, systems, and second-order consequences
* Navigates ambiguity across LLMs, APIs, and semi-structured corpora
* Gets excited by the edge cases most people run away from
* No research-for-research’s-sake — we ship fast and learn even faster
* Big bonus if you’ve shipped AI products into production, not just demos


⸻

**What you’ll be responsible for:**

* Designing and implementing LLM-powered workflows across tax, finance, and compliance
* Building and scaling Graphiti-like knowledge systems for memory and retrieval
* Owning prompt pipelines, vector stores, fine-tuned models, and evals
* Becoming an Oracle with a model of the customer and the domain in your head


⸻

**Your hard skillset:**

* Deep understanding of how LLMs actually work under the hood—beyond the hype
* Fluency with APIs like OpenAI, Gemini, Claude; experience with structured evals
* Comfortable working across Python and cloud infra (GCP or Azure)
* Strong grasp of embeddings, RAG, structured retrieval, and production-grade inference
* Bonus if you’ve contributed to or built internal tooling for model debugging or evals


⸻

**Your soft skillset:**

* Ruthlessly pragmatic—knows when to ship and when to iterate
* Empathetic with users and critical of vague assumptions
* Deeply collaborative across product, engineering, and operations
* Obsessively curious—you want to understand everything about the domain you’re automating
* You own your outcomes—and love having your work in front of real users daily


⸻

**Growth and Levels:**


We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.


We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.


This isn’t a comfy AI role. It’s fast, focused, and brutally user-driven.


You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.


⸻

**The process**

* Quick intro call
* Code and system walkthrough + async technical task
* Final round with our team
* Optional 2 to 3 day paid trial
* Then we decide together if this is the right fight


⸻


If you want to work with real users, real constraints, and build AI that goes far beyond chatbot demos—this is it.


Compensation Range: $71.5K - $104K

title: Bussiness Owner
description:
**Affärsansvarig för identitets- och åtkomstlösningar med fokus på Active Directory och Microsoft Entra ID**


I denna roll ansvarar du för att leda och driva arbetet med identitetsplattformar, där teknisk expertis och ett strategiskt förhållningssätt är avgörande. Du förväntas agera som teknisk rådgivare och fungera som en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att lösningar för identitetshantering möter verksamhetens och säkerhetskrav.


Uppdraget innebär ett nära samarbete med flera interna team såsom IT-säkerhet, cloud-specialister, och arkitekturforum för att säkra kvalitativa och hållbara leveranser. Du har en viktig roll i att samordna teknik, verksamhetsmål och strategiska initiativ inom identitetshantering.


För att lyckas i rollen krävs:

* Stark teknisk förståelse för autentiseringslösningar och protokoll såsom SSO, MFA, Federation, OAuth och SAML.
* Goda kunskaper i SCIM och OIDC för integration och automatisering av identitetsflöden.
* Erfarenhet av katalogtjänster och identitetssystem som Microsoft Entra ID, Active Directory och LDAP.
* Förmåga att arbeta proaktivt, ta initiativ och leverera resultat i komplexa IT-miljöer.
* Meriterande med mycket god kompetens i PowerShell för automatisering och effektiv hantering av miljöer.


Rollen passar dig som kombinerar teknisk spets med strategiskt tänkande och har erfarenhet av att verka i större organisationer med höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet.

 **Om Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Migration Practice Lead
description:
**Strategiska migrationer med AWS Migration Acceleration Program**


Hos Elastic Move har vi arbetat med AWS sedan 2009 och utvecklat ett djupt strategiskt partnerskap i rollen av AWS Advanced Consulting Partner. Som en del av Co-native-gruppen kombinerar vi vår expertis med över 50 AWS-certifierade specialister, och vi genomför nu en kraftfull satsning på att expandera vårt migrationserbjudande.


Vår vision är att genomföra moln-migrationer och moderniseringar med fokus på att göra kundernas miljöer så “cloud native” som möjligt. Detta innebär att vi inte bara flyttar arbetslaster till molnet utan också omformar dem för att fullt ut dra nytta av molnets fördelar – skalbarhet, elasticitet, kostnadseffektivitet och innovationshastighet.


Som Migration Practice Lead kommer du att leda vår migrationssatsning genom att:

* Driva strategisk dialog med kunder om deras migrationsresa
* Samordna och leda migrationsteam för att säkerställa framgångsrika leveranser
* Fungera som brygga mellan AWS, kunden och våra tekniska team
* Utveckla och implementera vår migrationsmethodologi baserad på AWS best practices
* Säkerställa att AWS Migration Acceleration Program utnyttjas effektivt för att accelerera kundernas migrationer


Din roll handlar om att utveckla vårt migrationsprogram och erbjudanden, orkestrera migrationsprojekt, säkerställa kvalitet i leveranser och driva kundernas migrationsresa framåt. Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med AWS-specialister och vara vår huvudkontakt i migrationsfrågor.

**Vårt nära partnerskap med AWS**
---------------------------------


Elastic Move har ett djupt och strategiskt partnerskap med AWS, särskilt inom migrationsområdet. Detta ger dig som Migration Practice Lead unika möjligheter:

* Direkt tillgång till AWS-specialister och tekniska resurser
* Möjlighet att bygga upp intern migrationskompetens
* Gemensamma kundmöten med AWS-representanter
* Tillgång till AWS-finansiering för kvalificerade migrationsprojekt


Detta nära samarbete är avgörande för att framgångsrikt driva komplexa migrationsprojekt och maximera värdet för våra kunder.

**Som person är du…**
---------------------


… en strategisk ledare med teknisk förståelse och utmärkt kommunikationsförmåga. Du har talang för att bygga relationer med både kunder och tekniska team. Du förstår affärsvärdet av molnmigrationer och kan översätta tekniska koncept till affärsvärde. Du drivs av att hjälpa organisationer att modernisera sina IT-miljöer och trivs med att leda team i en dynamisk miljö.

**Vi tror att du har:**
-----------------------

* 3+ års erfarenhet av molnmigrationer, varav minst 1 år med AWS
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda komplexa migrationsprojekt
* Djup förståelse för AWS migrationsmetodologier och best practices
* Förmåga att bygga och leda högpresterande migrationsteam
* Flexibilitet och är förändringsbenägen samt lösningsorienterad
* Utmärkt kundkommunikation och förmåga att hantera intressenter på alla nivåer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt AWS Migration Acceleration Program
* Förståelse för ekonomiska aspekter av molnmigrationer och TCO-analyser
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska (tal och skrift)

**Det är även fördelaktigt om du har:**
---------------------------------------

* Erfarenhet av migreringsverktyg som AWS Application Migration Service, Database Migration Service och liknande
* Minst en AWS-certifiering
* Kunskap om AWS Landing Zone och Control Tower
* Bakgrund inom projektledning eller programledning
* Erfarenhet av att bygga upp och utveckla konsultteam

**Din roll som teamledare**
---------------------------


Som Migration Practice Lead kommer du att:

* Bygga och utveckla vårt migrationserbjudande baserat på AWS best practices
* Leda och koordinera migrationsteam bestående av arkitekter, ingenjörer och specialister
* Säkerställa att leveranser följer våra processer och håller hög kvalitet
* Hantera kundförväntningar och bygga långsiktiga relationer
* Identifiera och hantera risker i migrationsprojekt
* Utveckla teamets kompetens och förmåga att leverera komplexa migrationer
* Samarbeta nära med AWS för att maximera värdet av vårt partnerskap


Din förmåga att leda team, koordinera resurser och säkerställa framgångsrika leveranser är central för denna roll.

**Elastic Move erbjuder:**
--------------------------

* Kompetensutveckling - 10% av arbetstiden, och betalda certifieringar
* En kultur med högt i tak, där du kan vara med och påverka företagets riktning
* Flexibilitet i arbetsuppgifter och tid
* Stor möjlighet till distansarbete
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Möjlighet att arbeta nära AWS och bygga ett värdefullt nätverk

**Om Elastic Move och Co-native**
---------------------------------


Elastic Move grundades 2009 och har sedan dess varit i framkant av AWS-utvecklingen i Norden. Som AWS Advanced Tier Services Partner erbjuder vi Cloud Migration, Cloud Optimization, Digital Transformation och Cloud Security.


Vi är en del av Co-native, Nordens första grupp av molnspecialistföretag, som tillsammans erbjuder kunderna skräddarsydda lösningar för digital transformation, säkerhet och en mängd andra molntjänster inom Amazon Web Services och Microsoft Azure.


Som en del av Co-native får vi som molnspecialister samma resurser som de stora IT-grupperna, samtidigt som vi fortsätter att vara de agila, flexibla och högkompetenta partners som kunderna efterfrågar

title: Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  





 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

**Required:**



* 3+ years of relevant experience
* General knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers



**Nice to Have:**



* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**

 Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us At Unit4, we offer:
   

 • a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful;
   

 • balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being;
   

 • talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry;
   

 • a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet;
   

 • a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.
   

  

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: ML-Engineer / Data Scientist
description:
**About Eghed** 




 Eghed is an expertise company / consulting firm passionate about creating the AI solutions of the future. We are an innovative team with a strong passion for technology and an entrepreneurial spirit that permeates everything we do. Through close collaborations with our partners, both on-site and in-house, we develop solutions that not only meet today’s needs but also open doors to tomorrow’s possibilities. We have already developed proprietary IP that accelerates our deliveries, and we are constantly seeking new ways to push the boundaries of what is possible.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We are now looking for an ML-Engineer / Data Scientist for one of our exciting client partnerships!
 



 You will work in a small team alongside a Quant and a Systems Engineer. Your primary responsibility will be implementing machine learning models for production, optimizing them to run on CPU or GPU compute nodes as needed. You will also develop supporting tools for model tuning and evaluation. This role involves collaboration with both the Quant and Systems Engineer, requiring overlapping skills.
 



  





 Here at Eghed, you’ll have the opportunity to help build the company from the ground up, shape our technical solutions, and be a key player in our continued growth. We love individuals who are accustomed to solving complex problems and who thrive in a dynamic environment where no two days are the same.
 



  





**Requirements** 



* Have at least 3 years of relevant experience in the field of data, preferably with a consulting background.
* Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and the underlying mathematics.
* Experience in programming and building production-ready systems.
* Ability to optimize models for performance and scalability.
* Are skilled at navigating cloud-based platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and various database technologies.
* Thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you have the freedom to think and create on a large scale.
* Are committed to contributing to the company’s success and growth and have an entrepreneurial spark.



  





**Your Responsibilities May Include** 



* Leverages data to solve complex problems, extract meaningful insights, and inform decision-making processes within an organization.
* Work at the intersection of statistics, programming, and business, using tools like machine learning, data mining, and predictive modeling to analyze large datasets.
* Gather, clean, and process data, developing and training algorithms, and present findings in a way that is understandable and actionable for stakeholders.
* Helps both us and our partners to optimize processes, identify trends, and develop data-driven strategies for growth and innovation.



  





**Why Eghed?** 




 At Eghed, you won’t just get a job – you’ll get an opportunity to join a journey where you can make an impact and create real change. We are a team that values innovation, collaboration, and a healthy dose of fresh thinking. Here, you’ll have the space to grow both professionally and personally, and we look forward to hearing your ideas and visions for the future.
 



  





**Application** 




 Please note that we only accept candidates currently living in the Stockholm area. Be prepared to spend a couple of days a week on-site in our Stockholm office.

title: Customer Support Agent
description:
**We are looking for tech-savvy Customer Support Agent to join our Tech team in Stockholm.**
 That’s what we’re doing here at Mynewsdesk! We help all companies, not only the established ones, with access to an audience to grow engagement for their mission and build brand awareness
   

  

 Mynewsdesk is a leading online PR-platform, currently serving about 4000 customers world wide.
   

  

 We are expanding our customer base and need to work smart to keep our high quality and personalized support and service that we today supply our customers with.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage technical issues reported by customers and colleagues
* Collaborate extensively within your team and across other departments to ensure smooth operations and continuous learning
* Work closely with the Product development teams to make sure we come up with the best solutions for our customers
* Contribute to process improvements and innovation within the team, particularly focusing on AI integrations for customer support function


 This role is vital in how our customers perceive us as a company and their experience with the product. Our aim is to create an environment in which you can grow, develop and – most importantly - succeed!
   

  

**What are we looking for?**
* A customer centric and analytical troubleshooter who will join our international Support team
* You are eager to learn, driven to understand the product thoroughly, continuously seek improvement, and explore alternative solutions and ways of working
* You thrive on helping customers and resolving their issues. With a strong sense of empathy, you understand different perspectives and tailor your approach to meet each customer’s needs


**Desired Skills And Experience**
* Language skills: Proficiency in Swedish and English is required. Knowledge of Norwegian, Danish, or German is considered a plus and highly valued in this role.
* At least 2 years experience in technical support management or other service related work
* Experience working with a technical product
* Working knowledge of different browsers and operating systems
* Knowledge of how to write in an instructional way when communicating with customers
* Previous experience of working with cloud based services (SaaS)
* Previous experience within PR and Communication and knowledge of any programming language is an advantage


 Mynewsdesk works actively to ensure that our workplace is fulfilling for everyone regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion or disability.
   

  

 We have fun, we innovate, and we provide a market-leading PR platform.
   

  

 Answer the questions in the application process and preferably apply with your LinkedIn profile. No CV or cover letter is required.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Questions? Contact Hiring Manager linda.ryberg@mynewsdesk.com or Talent Acquisition Manager linda.stuve@mynewsdesk.com
   

  

 Mynewsdesk is a true pioneer, providing communicators with a modern digital PR service. With just one click, you can give the right audiences direct access to relevant press releases, blog posts, social media feeds, high-resolution images and graphics, videos, and more – at the right time. Influencers can start following your newsroom, engage with content, and become part of a network of influencers.

title: Global Contingent Workforce Partner
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are looking for a Contingent Workforce Partner to oversee the end-to-end process for our contingent workforce and shape the future of contingent workforce management at Sinch.
   

  

 The ideal candidate has experience in contingent workforce management, vendor relations, and workforce operations. The role will be located in Stockholm and will report to Head of Talent Acquisition EMEA & APAC.
   

  

**Some of your key responsibilities will be;**
* Manage the full lifecycle of contingent workers (requests, contracts, extensions, payments). You will be the primary person to handle operations in EMEA. In APAC and US, you will have support in local execution.
* Act as the primary contact and advisor for the business as well as HR in questions relating to contingent workforce.
* Manage relationships with external vendors, staffing agencies, and system providers ensuring service quality and cost-effectiveness.
* Own and refine the roadmap for contingent workforce strategy, ensuring alignment with business needs.
* Identify and implement process improvements to enhance operational efficiency.
* Enablement of key metrics reporting and insights for informed decision-making.


**Requirements**
* Experience in contingent workforce management, HR operations, procurement, or vendor management.
* Experience with Vendor Management Systems (VMS) or HRIS platforms.
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.
* Strong analytical skills and strategic problem solver with experience in data-driven decision-making.
* Knowledge of workforce compliance, contracts, and procurement processes.
* Experience in global or multi-country workforce management. Experience from the US market is an extra bonus!
* Familiarity with labor laws and regulations related to contingent workforce engagement.


**OUR HIRING PROCESS**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Stockholms starkaste lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Om Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är Europas ledande konsultföretag inom ServiceNow och digital transformation. Vi hjälper företag och organisationer att effektivisera sina verksamheter genom innovativa teknologilösningar. Med fler än 4000 ServiceNow-experter besitter vi marknadens största och mest framstående ServiceNow-team där får du möjligheten att arbeta med dem mest spännande projekten samt utvecklas i en dynamisk och framåtlutad arbetsmiljö. Nu tar vi nästa stora kliv och satsar ännu hårdare på vår ledande position inom ServiceNow. Hos oss får du chansen att vara med och driva utvecklingen framåt, forma framtidens lösningar och göra verklig skillnad. Vill du vara en del av vårt ledande team?
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 I rollen som lösningsarkitekt inom ServiceNow kommer du vara en central del i utvecklingen och designen av moderna lösningar för att effektivisera arbetsflöden och processer. Som Elite Partner för ServiceNow har vi en av Skandinaviens största och mest kvalificerade konsultgrupper med närmare 500 dedikerade experter. Vi söker nu en senior profil som kan ta en ledande roll i våra teamleveranser tillsammans med våra experter som utvecklar innovativa lösningar för våra kunder.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter:**
* Designa och implementering avancerade lösningar inom ServiceNow.
* Ledande roll i att utveckla och konfigurera plattformen för att möta specifika krav och behov.
* Arbeta nära affärsavdelningar för att förstå och översätta deras verksamhetsbehov till tekniska lösningar.
* Driva tekniska workshops och rådgivning gentemot kunder.
* Aktiv deltagande i agila team och förmåga att leda och inspirera.


**För att vara framgångsrik i rollen tror vi att du har:**
* Flerårig erfarenhet som arkitekt inom ServiceNow med uppsättning, implementering, utveckling och konfiguration inom plattformen.
* Expertis inom Javascript, HTML, SQL och ITIL.
* Vana av att arbeta i agila team.
* Relevanta certifieringar inom ServiceNow.
* Eftergymnasial utbildning.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* En spännande arbetsmiljö hos Europas ledande ServiceNow-konsultbolag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med innovativa lösningar och den senaste tekniken.
* Kompetensutveckling genom certifieringar, utbildningar och mentorskap.
* Hybrid arbetsmodell samt konkurrenskraftiga villkor och förmåner


**Om ServiceNow-teamet på Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är Nordens ledande expert inom ServiceNow – vi har den största och mest specialiserade kompetensen på marknaden. Vårt starka och sammansvetsade team levererar omfattande och högkvalitativa lösningar, där flera av våra erfarna ServiceNow-konsulter samarbetar för att maximera värdet för våra kunder. Vi drivs av innovation, samarbete och kunskapsutbyte – tillsammans sätter vi nya standarder och skapar framtidens digitala lösningar. Vill du arbeta med de bästa? Då är Sopra Steria platsen för dig.
   

  

**Om Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är en av Europas ledande aktörer inom digital transformation, med över 60 000 medarbetare i mer än 30 länder globalt. Vi driver innovation och hjälper företag och organisationer att effektivisera, utvecklas och skapa långsiktigt värde genom banbrytande teknologilösningar.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar de främsta experterna inom sina områden i en dynamisk och framtidsorienterad miljö där samarbete, nytänkande och teknisk spetskompetens står i centrum.
   

  

**Ansökan:**
 Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vara en del av en framstående arbetsplats, ansök genom att ladda upp ditt CV. Kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryterare, Teodor Nellvik (teodor.nellvik@soprasteria.com) eller Business Owner Mikael Kroglund (mikael.kroglund@soprasteria.com) för eventuella frågor om tjänsten.
   

  

 På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

**Välkommen till Sopra Steria - där din kompetens formar framtidens digitala lösningar!**
**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**About DigiProc** 




 DigiProc is an innovative SaaS company helping businesses gain control over their supplier relationships through our powerful platform. We enable companies to negotiate better prices, reduce risk, and manage their entire supplier ecosystem from a single solution. As a fast-growing startup in the heart of Stockholm, we're looking for passionate individuals who thrive in a dynamic environment and want to make a real impact.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Customer Success Manager at DigiProc, you'll be the bridge between our customers and our platform, ensuring they achieve maximum value from their investment. You'll work directly with clients to drive adoption, demonstrate ROI, and build lasting relationships that lead to renewals and growth.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Onboard new customers and guide them through the implementation process
* Help clients execute successful supplier negotiations to achieve price savings, improved payment terms, implementation of Code of Conduct policies etc.
* Drive platform adoption and ensure customers realize tangible value from DigiProc
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders at client organizations
* Work closely with our Sales team on renewal strategies and identifying expansion opportunities
* Monitor customer health metrics and proactively address potential issues
* Gather customer feedback to help improve our platform and services
* Serve as the voice of the customer within DigiProc



  





**Requirements** 



* 2-5 years of experience in Customer Success or Account Management, preferably in a B2B SaaS environment
* Proven track record of driving customer satisfaction and retention
* Strong communication and relationship-building skills
* Problem-solving mindset and ability to think strategically
* Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Experience with procurement, supplier management, or related fields is a plus
* Fluent in Swedish and English



  





**Why Join DigiProc?** 



* Make a real impact in a growing startup where your voice matters
* Join a culture that encourages innovation and "failing fast"
* Work with cutting-edge technology in a forward-thinking environment
* Enjoy a collaborative atmosphere with a team that values having fun while working
* Be part of a close-knit team of 14 passionate professionals
* Work from our centrally located Stockholm office with a familiar feeling



  





 At DigiProc, we believe in creating an environment where everyone can contribute to our shared success. We're looking for someone who's not afraid to roll up their sleeves, take initiative, and help shape the future of our company and product.
 



  





**Location** 




 Kammakargatan 48, Stockholm
 



  





**Employment Type** 



* Full-time



  





*DigiProc is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of background.*

title: Cloud Support Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Cloud Support Engineer to build a career with Canonical and support the technical needs of customers leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 We regularly solve interesting, technical problems. From triaging complex Cloud environment issues, Linux kernel crashes we've never seen before to OS configuration issues and root cause analysis, we provide an expert level of support and satisfaction to our peer groups and customers. We are rapidly expanding and are looking for talented problem solvers with a passion for working on the next generation of Ubuntu solutions for our customers.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a globally remote role, unless specified otherwise.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Investigate issues reported by customers by researching and escalating issues
* Work to resolve complex customer problems related to Canonical's portfolio of products.
* Ownership of results: Ensure that each support case owned by you is handled according to our Service Level Agreement (SLA) with the highest possible customer satisfaction by setting the right expectations and fulfilling your commitments.
* Engage directly with customers and work collaboratively by phone, ticketing system, and remote sessions to resolve their issues.
* Participate in a regular weekend working rotation.
* Contribute new knowledge base articles and maintain existing articles, ensuring shared knowledge and lessons learned are available to customers.
* Understanding Ubuntu development process to be able to set customer expectations correctly on timeline for a fix.


**What are we looking for in you**
* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
* Hands-on and extensive working experience in supporting Linux systems including 3 or more of:
+ Virtualization / Cloud - primarily using KVM or OpenStack.
+ Containers - especially with Docker, LXD/LXC, or Kubernetes.
+ Storage technologies - block, object and network.
+ Networking (bonding, firewalling, bridging, switching, network file system tuning, MTU issues, etc.).

* Cloud computing expertise in provisioning, monitoring, orchestration, etc.
* Advanced troubleshooting experience:
+ Linux integration with other environments (authentication/directory services, network file systems, etc.).
+ Ability to navigate effectively stack traces and logs, and advise on next steps.
+ Solid understanding of OS and Application level bugs and when to escalate to the correct team.

* Programming fundamentals in any language.
* Extensive Customer support experience is key:
+ Customer needs are top priority.
+ Communicate professionally, emphatically, clearly and set the right expectations.

* Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long.


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: AI Engineer
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 150 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**The Role**
 As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems, mainly through usage of LLMs from various providers. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.
   

  

 You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the Generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.
   

  

 You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.
   

  

 As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
* Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
* Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
* Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
* Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
* Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development. Experience from other languages is also valued as we’re always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
* Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don’t require deep experience in all areas.
* You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
* Proficiency in Swedish


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Location**
 We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.
   

  

**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software

description:

 Join our disruptive evolution of the software industry as a Strategic Account Executive.
   

  

 Every business/industry/company is looking to modernize the way they work. title: Sales Executive - Fintech SaaS
description:
**Sales Executive- Net New Business, Fintech Solutions Sales Office of CFO**
**Stockholm based, Hybrid role**
**About Medius**
 Medius is a Swedish origin company & a leading global provider of cloud-based SaaS spend management solutions, helping organizations drive their business forward by enabling best-in-class process efficiency, cost-savings, and greater financial control.
   

  

 Spend management doesn’t ring a bell? This term describes the process from placing an order through its delivery, verification, invoicing to its payment. Our products help companies at every step of the purchasing process, increasing their security and speeding it up. We use the latest advances in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning to automatically capture and process invoices.
   

  

 If you are seeking a stimulating environment characterized by unparalleled momentum and rapid growth, look no further. Join us as we lead the charge in reshaping the future of spend management, setting new standards of excellence, and driving impactful change across industries.
   

  

 For more info: www.medius.com
   

  

**Our values**
* Connect: We believe in the power of people, both individually and collectively. Our success is driven by respect and understanding, with a shared commitment to empowering finance teams of the future.
* Question: We embrace challenges and value diverse perspectives. By questioning and collaborating, we unlock better solutions and continuously innovate.
* Own: We are proactive, decisive, and committed to delivering results. We anticipate customer needs and follow through, earning their trust to focus on what they do best.


**Corporate Brief….**
 We Are Expanding Our Team And Seeking a Bright, Enthusiastic, Experienced Software Sales Professional With a Hunter Mentality To Help Us Realize Our Goals. If You Have The Following Character Traits, Then This Job Could Be For You
   

  

* You have 2-3 years of multithreaded, B2B Fintech SaaS sales experience to CFO within mid market
* Fluent in Swedish & English, both spoken and written.
* You have the drive, creativity, and experience to make a big impact on our company’s growth
* You are a doer and love the sacrifice/work it takes to win big
* You thrive in an entrepreneurial culture, where you own/drive your region/business


**Opportunity Description**
 Your focus will be the Nordics region. You will be expected to own your territory and build your book of business, while partnering with external business partners, internal and external marketing for lead gen. There won’t be any bureaucracy to hold you back – just your own energy, wits and experience to write your own paycheck.
   

  

**Is This Job for You?**
 We need a great sales person to explore and sell into mid to large enterprises in Retail & Wholesale Distribution, Manufacturing running Microsoft, M3 and SAP ERP in the Nordics region. Our entrepreneurial culture will give you the opportunity to influence our direction and your career while having the stability, benefits and career possibilities of a global company.
   

  

**Some Of The Tasks You Will Perform**
* Generating pipeline
* Present product to prove value and fit for purpose
* Build credible business cases
* Performing web-based and on-site meetings presenting our cloud accounting automation solution to finance, accounting and IT
* Writing pricing proposals and negotiating contracts


**Location**
 Stockholm, Hybrid
   

  

**Enthusiastic?**
 Do you recognize yourself in this role and do you want to learn more about us? Apply today!
   

  

  

  

 Medius links invoice capture, processing, and payment to replace the worry and wondering of managing AP with calm and confidence. Medius goes far beyond basic automation by using artificial intelligence to do most of the work – so invoices get coded, approved and paid; customers get to go home and rest easy; and businesses can trust budgets and forecasts.
   

  

 For more information, please visit medius.com.
   

  

**Our values**
* Connect: We believe in the power of people, both individually and collectively. Our success is driven by respect and understanding, with a shared commitment to empowering finance teams of the future.
* Question: We embrace challenges and value diverse perspectives. By questioning and collaborating, we unlock better solutions and continuously innovate.
* Own: We are proactive, decisive, and committed to delivering results. We anticipate customer needs and follow through, earning their trust to focus on what they do best.

title: Machine Learning Engineer & Data Engineer
description:
Drivs du av att arbeta med data och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom machine learning och data engineering för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.
   

  

**Din kompetens & profil**
**Machine Learning Engineer**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller och som trivs med att analysera stora mängder data för att skapa insikter och affärsvärde.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:
   

  

* Programmering: Stark kompetens inom Python, Java eller Scala.
* ML-ramverk: Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn eller Keras.
* Modellutveckling: Kompetens inom modellträning, optimering och hyperparameter-tuning.
* Prediktiv modellering: Erfarenhet av regression, klassificering, klustring och djupinlärning.
* Databehandling: Vana vid dataförbehandling och analys, gärna med verktyg som Pandas, NumPy och Dask.
* Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av ML-pipelines på AWS SageMaker, Azure ML eller Google Cloud AI.
* MLOps: Erfarenhet av CI/CD-principer för ML och verktyg som MLflow, Kubeflow, eller TensorFlow Extended (TFX).
* Analytisk förmåga: Förmåga att tolka och kommunicera resultat till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter


**Data Engineer**
 Vi söker även dig som är erfaren inom data engineering och kan bygga skalbara dataplattformar, pipelines och integrationer som möjliggör analys och avancerad datamodellering.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:
   

  

* Programmering och scripting: Erfarenhet av Python, Java, Scala, eller SQL.
* Dataplattformar och pipelines: Kunskap om verktyg som Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Airflow, eller DBT.
* Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera dataflöden i molnmiljöer som AWS (Glue, Redshift), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) eller Google Cloud (BigQuery, Dataflow).
* Data Lakes och Data Warehouses: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataarkitektur och lagringslösningar för att hantera stora datamängder.
* ETL/ELT-processer: Erfarenhet av att utveckla effektiva och robusta ETL/ELT-pipelines.
* Big Data-ramverk: Kunskap inom hantering och bearbetning av stora datamängder med exempelvis Hadoop, Hive, eller Snowflake.
* Versionshantering och samarbete: God förståelse för versionshantering i Git och vana att arbeta i agila team.
* Data Governance och säkerhet: Förståelse för datahanteringsprinciper, GDPR och dataetik.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

**Frågor och kontakt**
 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 #IT

title: Strategic Sales Manager
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: Computer and Network Security, Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Why Join Us?
   

  

 As the world’s leading vendor of Cyber Security, facing the most sophisticated threats and attacks, we’ve assembled a global team of the most driven, creative, and innovative people. At Check Point, our employees are redefining the security landscape by meeting our customers’ real-time needs and providing our cutting-edge technologies and services to an ever-growing customer base.
   

  

 Check Point Software Technologies has been honored by Time Magazine as one of the World’s Best Companies for 2024. We've also earned a spot on the Forbes list of the World’s Best Places to Work for five consecutive years (2020-2024) and recognized as one of the World’s Top Female-Friendly Companies. If you're passionate about making the world a safer place and want to be part of an award-winning company culture, we invite you to join us.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

 Check Point's Strategic Sales team's mission is to develop, lead, and win, together with the field sales teams, large strategic infinity ELA deals.
   

  

 Lead Infinity business in your region and work together with the Check Point’s local sales teams to develop large Infinity deals.
   

  

* Responsible for developing and growing the Infinity business in the Nordic region
* Participate in C level events and discussions as the evangelist for the Infinity Total Protection architecture
* Work with internal resources, account teams, and partners to create awareness and knowledge in the territory
* Support local account teams in closing large Infinity opportunities
* Responsible for training the local sales teams and partners
* Develop and manage the regional Infinity pipeline
* Responsible for coordinating technical and business HQ resources to support Infinity strategy in the Nordic region


**Qualifications**
* Account Management experience
* Technical Background as a CIO, CISO, CTO is an advantage
* Background in selling security and network-related applications
* Solution Selling is a must with desire to understand MEDPICC
* Experience with selling large deals and ELA
* Up to 50% + travel required
* A consistent track record of success is critical in selling multi-year enterprise deals
* Understands the region and has relationships with partners and customers in assigned territory
* Self-starter and a strong closer


**Don't meet every requirement? No problem. We're committed to fostering a diverse team of individuals. If you believe you have what it takes to thrive in our passionate, fun, remote-friendly, and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply. Your unique perspective might just challenge our preconceptions about who belongs in this role.**

title: Digital & Commercial Transformation Lead - Telecom
description:
*Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues both locally and around the world, reimagining what’s possible. In this role you will be part of building Public Safety & Critical Communications with deep expertise in telecom, connectivity, and mission-critical communications. We develop tailored applications and manage complex integrations to maximize the potential of technology. Join us and collaborate with the world's leading organizations to realize the full value of technology through innovative solutions.*
**The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced leader to drive digital and commercial transformation initiatives for leading telecom operators and public sector entities. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in commercial strategy, product portfolio restructuring, digital transformation, and consumer insights. This role requires a strong background in managing large-scale programs and working with multi-vendor ecosystems across BSS, ICT, OTT, and emerging technologies. Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Digital & Commercial Transformation: Implement digital strategies; transform B2B/B2C segments; drive go-to-market strategies; leverage analytics for commercial strategies.
* Program & Project Leadership: Direct large-scale BSS transformations; oversee FTTx network rollouts; manage PMOs for governance.
* Strategic Advisory & Innovation: Develop pricing roadmaps; lead feasibility assessments; advise on PPP models in public sectors.


**Your profile**
* 15+ years of experience in telecom, media, or technology consulting.
* Strategic Thinking: Expertise in commercial strategy and revenue optimization.
* Digital Transformation: Proven leadership in digital initiatives.
* Program Management: Strong track record in managing large projects.
* Industry Expertise: Deep understanding of telecom BSS, Smart Cities, OTT.
* Analytical Skills: Ability to leverage data for decision-making.
* Leadership & Stakeholder Management: Experience with C-level executives and regulatory bodies.
* Education & Certification: bachelor’s or master’s degree in relevant fields; certifications like in Program Management (PMP, PRINCE2) or Agile methodologies are advantageous.
* You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the telecom industry, including professional certifications in telecom technologies and BSS/OSS platforms
* Our Values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Support Engineer
description:
Hive Streaming partners with over 150 of the world’s largest enterprises to deliver exceptional video experiences that drive alignment, innovation, and measurable impact through live video. In 2023, we launched our VX platform and next-generation products, focused on enabling world-class video experiences that scale effortlessly across global organizations.
   

  

**About The Team**
 You’ll be joining the
 **Global Support Team** 
 , a highly collaborative group of five engineers based across Sweden, the US, and Australia. We operate at the heart of Hive, ensuring live video events for some of the world’s largest enterprises run flawlessly.
   

  

 Our role goes beyond technical support - we’re trusted advisors, technical troubleshooters, and customer advocates. We step in when it matters most: supporting mission-critical broadcasts, turning insights into product improvements, and driving innovation by surfacing real-world needs from the field. With our unique position between customers and the product, we play a key role in making Hive’s video experiences seamless, resilient, and future-ready.
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are looking for a
 **Support Engineer** 
 to join this high-impact team. In this role, you’ll be right in the middle of the action, supporting enterprise customers during their most important video moments while also working closely with Product and Engineering to solve issues, improve workflows, and help shape the future of our platform.
   

  

 You’ll be responsible for live event support, complex troubleshooting, and driving internal initiatives that strengthen our operations. This role blends technical problem-solving with strategic thinking and close customer collaboration. It’s not just about solving problems- it's about delivering exceptional experiences and continuously improving how we work and what we offer.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Handling daily support requests via our ticketing system (Jira Service Management)
* Troubleshooting product-related issues involving networking, video delivery, operations, and security
* Supporting silent testing and event monitoring (White Glove support)
* Provisioning customer resources (e.g., installers, credentials)
* Analyzing Hive Insights reports and communicating findings to customers
* Advising clients on integrating Hive into their enterprise architecture
* Contributing to and improving internal knowledge bases and best practices
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams including Engineering, Sales and Product.


**Our Tech Stack**
* Jira Service Management & Confluence
* Salesforce
* Databricks (upcoming!)


**Who You Are**
 We're looking for someone with a strong technical foundation — but just as importantly, the right attitude. At Hive, how you work is just as valuable as what you know. We are looking for someone with:
   

  

* 2+ years of hands-on experience in technical support, ideally in a SaaS or Managed Service Provider in the enterprise segment
* Solid networking knowledge (VPNs, firewalls, proxies, routers, etc.)
* Familiarity with tools like Fiddler, Wireshark, Proxyman, mpv, OBS, ffmpeg, or similar
* Amazing communication skills with the ability to explain complex concepts in a simple and customer-friendly way
* Comfort navigating and supporting enterprise-level architecture
* Excellent written and spoken English – it turns out
* Experience in video communication, video protocols or content delivery networks is a strong plus


**And Just As Importantly, We Believe You Are**
* A self-starter who thrives in a collaborative, diverse, and fast-paced environment.
* A solution-oriented thinker who enjoys digging into technical challenges.
* Someone who genuinely cares about the customer experience and wants to make an impact.
* A believer in continuous improvement of products, processes, and yourself.
* Motivated to work in a company where innovation, empowerment, and customer focus are part of the everyday culture.


**Location**
 Stockholm, Sweden (Primarily on-site, partially hybrid) | Full-time
   

  

**Why join Hive?**
* Global Impact: Partner with over 150 of the world’s largest enterprises, helping them achieve alignment and measurable success through live video.
* Dynamic Culture: Join a collaborative, fast-paced environment that values execution, innovation, and customer focus.
* Empowered Leadership: Play a pivotal role in shaping Hive’s future while connecting directly with the customers who rely on our solutions.
* Pioneering Innovation: Be at the forefront of building strategic communication tools that empower enterprises to thrive amidst massive change.


 🐶Just a heads up, we're a dog-friendly office (office in Sweden).

title: Cloud Solutions Architect - Alliances
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring an
 **Cloud Solutions Architect in our Alliances team** 
 to help our biggest partners (companies like Intel, Nvidia, Google, Dell, HP, Accenture, Tata and the like) understand and embrace our open source platform for themselves and their customers.
   

  

 Our worldwide field engineering team apply expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, OpenStack, Kubernetes, AI/MLOps and a wide range of associated technologies. We are experts in the whole open source stack, from kernel to desktop, from cloud to the edge. Our team is also interested in business problems - building things reliably, efficiently and cost-effectively, and we have to learn to speak the language of our customers and their industries.
   

  

 We help global companies embrace public and private cloud infrastructure, cloud native operations, and open source applications. For this team we are looking for several Alliances Engineers to support OEM (hardware manufacturers), GSI (global system integrators), ISV (independent software vendors), Channel partners and Public Cloud alliance partners. You will support various alliances and partners of Canonical to adopt our products and technologies, help business leaders to define joint go-to-market programs with partners from the technical standpoint.
   

  

 We often say that our field engineers have 'the hardest job at Canonical' because customers can ask about any aspect of our solutions and products and expect a thoughtful, well-informed answer. We always want to do the best thing for our partners and customers, regardless of our company interests, and field engineers are the people we trust to ensure that is true.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This is a home-based role, we are hiring worldwide.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Understand Ubuntu, Linux, networking and services in real-world environments
* Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, Ceph, and Spark either On-Premises or in Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
* Architect and integrate popular open source software such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Cassandra and NGINX
* Help partners to offer and architect joint solutions utilizing Canonical's technologies on top of the public clouds and in the data center
* Design and publish joint Reference Architectures and perform technical validations with various partners
* Prepare and run onboarding sessions/workshops with various partners' teams to promote Canonical products and solutions


 If you have a passion for the latest open source technologies, cloud-native development, data center technologies such as Kubernetes and computer networking, you will love the Alliances Architect role at Canonical.
   

  

 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Extensive experience with Linux (Ubuntu preferred), Kubernetes, Ceph, software automation
* Experience designing and implementing solutions on top of public or private clouds
* Python and bash understanding, troubleshooting skills
* Fluent written and spoken English
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* High motivation, ability to multi-task and follow-up reliably on commitments
* Interest in customer-facing engagement, including pitching, demonstrating and understanding customer environment and needs
* Interest in new technologies like LXD, Juju and Snaps
* Ability to travel globally up to 30% of the time
* Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related technical field experience


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Integrationsutvecklare - sökes till Accelerate at Iver
description:
*Nu letar vi efter nya medarbetare som vill vara med på vår resa. Som en del av Accelerate at Iver ligger du i teknikens absoluta framkant och arbetar med spännande digitaliserings- och transformationsprojekt hos marknadsledande kunder. Vi är idag över 300 konsulter som brinner för att realisera digitala möjligheter i molnet. Tillsammans med våra kunder stänger vi gapet mellan aspiration och framgångsrik implementation. Nu söker vi en Integrationsutvecklare som vill bli en del av Accelerate at Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Din roll** 
**på Accelerate at Iver?**
 Som integrationsutvecklare hos Accelerate at Iver kommer du att bidra till att bygga robusta, moderna och långsiktiga integrationslösningar. Lösningarna byggs främst på Microsoft-teknologi, både cloud och on-prem.
   

  

 Vi söker en social och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett stort driv och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken.
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av vårt team och bidra till att bygga framtidens integrationslösningar?
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Utveckling & Implementering: Erfarenhet av att ta fram teknisk och funktionell design för integrationslösningar. Samarbeta med integrationsarkitekter för att utveckla lösningar som uppfyller både verksamhetsmål och tekniska principer.
* Kodkvalitet & Optimering: Säkerställ högkvalitativ, underhållbar och återanvändbar kod. Förbättra befintliga integrationer för att uppnå bättre skalbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda.
* Samarbete: Arbeta självständigt eller i team tillsammans med bland annat projektledare, arkitekter, testare och produktägare.
* Support & Underhåll: Bidra till det löpande underhållet och utvecklingen av integrationslösningar.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Accelerate at Iver kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.
   

  

 Hos Accelerate at Iver får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med C#, .Net Core och Microservices i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.
   

  

 Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik.
   

  

 Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver får du ett antal fördelar som:
   

  

* En trygg och säker anställning
* Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Hälso & sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Pensions och försäkringsrådgivning
* Förmånsportal
* Timbank & volontärdag
* Medarbetar och familjeaktiviteter i olika former


**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
 Erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknologier som:
   

  

* C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework, XML, JSON, REST-APIer, Biceps
* Azure Integration Services: Logic Apps, Service Bus, Azure Functions, Azure API Management
* SQL Server, Azure SQL
* Azure, men meriterande med erfarenhet av andra plattformar såsom BizTalk, Mulesoft eller andra plattformar


 Kunskap om verktyg som Microsoft Visual Studio/Visual Studio Code, Postman, Git och Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Minst 2–4 års erfarenhet inom integrationsutveckling
   

  

 Du bör ha jobbat i agila team med scrum- eller kanban som arbetssätt, och vara van vid de olika rollerna och rollfördelningen som ett sådant arbetssätt innebär.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.
   

  

 Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!
   

  

 För denna position krävs Svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Accelerate at Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Magida Musa (magida.musa@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!

title: Senior Analytics & Performance Management Manager
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming businesses and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Do you know how to bring value out of data?
   

  

 If Yes, bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career! You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!
   

  

**About Our Nordic SAP Business Group**
 As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major transformation programs.
   

  

 Within our Nordic community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4, SAP BTP, Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, HANA, BW/4, and SAP RISE.
